title: Glad You Asked: VA Homeless Programs & How to Get Help
summary:
In this episode, Deputy Secretary Paul R. Lawrence, Ph.D., talks about how VA is working every day to end Veteran homelessness.
 
He highlights the National Call Center for Homeless Veterans (877-424-3838) and explains how Veterans and their families can access shelter, health care, and the benefits they’ve earned through service.

No Veteran should ever go without a safe place to call home, especially as the weather gets colder and the holiday season approaches.
 
If you or a Veteran you know needs support, please share this number and help us get every Veteran back to a stable, fulfilling life.

VA is here to help.
 
Call 877-424-3838.

title: VA News | Guard Your Benefits: Avoid Scams and Cyber Threats
summary:
In this episode of VA News, U.S. Army Veteran Earl Scott highlights the growing threat of cybercrime targeting Veterans and offer essential tips on how to protect yourself from fraud. Learn about common scams, key cyber safety steps, and how the VA Resource Navigator can help you access all your benefits and resources in one place.

For more information visit prevention.va.gov, and look for “VA Resource Navigator” under the Resources section, or call MyVA411 at (800) 698-2411.

Thank you for your service! #VANews #Veterans #CyberSafety #FraudPrevention #VeteranBenefits #VASupport #StaySafe

title: VA Health Chat for Veterans: Convenient VA Care at Your Fingertips
summary:
The VA Health Chat app enables you to connect with VA staff members in real time from anywhere you can use a mobile device or computer. 

With VA Health Chat, you can send secure chat messages to receive live medical advice for your non-life-threatening health concerns, such as minor injuries and illnesses. 

You can also chat to schedule a VA appointment or refill your VA prescriptions. 

For more information and to access the app, visit https://mobile.va.gov/app/va-health-chat.

title: Financing California’s Public Schools
summary: K–12 funding has reached record highs in recent years, and California’s per student spending is above the national average. title: 2025 National Veterans Day Observance
summary: The Veterans Day National Ceremony is held each year on November 11th at Arlington National Cemetery. The ceremony commences precisely at 11:00 a.m. with a wreath laying at the Tomb of the Unknowns and continues inside the Memorial Amphitheater with a parade of colors by Veterans’ organizations and remarks from dignitaries. The ceremony is intended to honor and thank all who served in the United States Armed Forces.

title: Examining Non-Citizens as US Law Enforcement Officers
summary:
Examining Non-Citizens as US Law Enforcement Officers

A Deep Dive Join us as we welcome back Mike Wood, author of 'Newhall Shooting: A Tactical Analysis.' We discuss the controversial topic of non-US citizens serving as peace officers across the country, with a focus on recent laws in California. Is this a necessary solution to manpower shortages or a dangerous precedent undermining US sovereignty and rule of law? Tune in as we delve into specific cases, legislative changes, and the broader implications for the law enforcement community and public safety.

summary:
Beyond Wokeness: A Call for True Leadership in Law Enforcement and Politics

With special guest Marc Gomez (Retired Sergeant CHP) we dive into the current state of leadership and its challenges. From the Attorney General candidate Jay Jones' scandal in Virginia to the controversial decision by Chicago PD's Chief of Patrol, we explore how politics influence critical decisions. We also examine Secretary of War Pete Hegseth's bold statements on restoring military standards and how this contrasts with the perceived lack of leadership in places like Chicago. How is leadership shaping the future of our institutions? Can we navigate through political influence to uphold professionalism and safety? Join the discussion and get the facts.

title: Honoring Fallen Officers and Tackling Threats to ICE Agents
summary:
Honoring Fallen Officers and Tackling Threats to ICE Agents

Join Chief Mark Garrett and special guest, Marcelo Arrue, as they discuss the tragic incident involving three Pennsylvania police officers and the critical lessons learned from such events. They also delve into the rising threats against ICE agents, including the alarming use of tracking apps. What can be done to ensure the safety of law enforcement officers? How can communities better support those who protect and serve?

title: ABC7: California retired veterans and families to benefit from new military pension tax exemption
summary: REDLANDS, Calif. (KABC) — Veterans have served and sacrificed for our nation, and on Tuesday, the state of California announced a new law to help them in retirement. That law will exempt part of their military pensions from state income tax. At American Legion Post 106 in Redlands, Assemblymember James Ramos (D-San Bernardino) stood before retired […]

title: Google Admits to Censorship: Who Controlled Youtube?
summary:
Google Admits to Censorship: A Deep Dive into Free Speech and Accountability

How did Google and Alphabet respond to pressure from the Biden administration on free speech and censorship? Examining the fallout from the assassination of Charlie Kirk, the implications for free speech, and a comprehensive review of political censorship allegations. Is free speech under threat?

source: The Official United States Marine Corps Public Website News
title: Thunderstruck: Marines compete in first-ever service-wide communications team competition
summary: U.S. Marines from across the globe competed in the inaugural Thunderstruck Communications Team Competition, hosted by Marine Wing Communications Squadron 38, Marine Air Control Group 38, 3rd Marine Aircraft Wing Sept. 10, 2025.

source: The Official United States Marine Corps Public Website News
title: III Marine Expeditionary Force proves readiness in command post field training exercise during Resolute Dragon 25
summary: For five days, from Sept. 12 to Sept. 16, 2025, III MEF Marines and Sailors traded air conditioning and office chairs for the realities of expeditionary command and control. The mission: Test the MEF staff’s ability to displace, set up, and operate as a fully functional command post anytime and in any austere environment, the kind of situation they might face if conflict disrupted established command centers.

title: PRESS RELEASE: Senate Judiciary Kicks Can Down the Road on Protecting Veterans from Claim Sharks
summary: For Immediate Release 9/9/25 Contact: Meghan Callahan, mc@callahanpa.com Today, California’s Senate Judiciary Committee chose to kick the can down the road and delay enacting needed protections for veterans from claim sharks. Rather than voting up or down on SB 694, they voted to send the bill to rules where the bill’s fate is uncertain.  SB […]

source: The Official United States Marine Corps Public Website News
title: Marine Corps initiates drone task force summits to accelerate UAS lethality
summary: In August, the Marine Corps began hosting drone task force summits to chart a way forward for operational units across the Marine Corps to effectively employ small drones. The drone task force leverages work done over the last several years by various units, including Marine Corps Special Operations Command, the infantry battalion experiment (IBX), and the Marine Corps Attack Drone Team (MCADT) to hone techniques for using small surveillance and lethal attack drones.
